sentences.en: ‘Anyone else would have done the same thing,’ he said with typical modesty.
sentences.cn: 换了谁都会这么做的。”他带着一贯的谦虚说道。

sentences.en: "Your modesty is a cover for your overweening conceit," she said.
sentences.cn: “你表面谦虚，骨子里目中无人。”她说道。

sentences.en: As conceit makes one lag behind, so modesty helps one make progress.
sentences.cn: 骄傲使人落后, 谦虚使人进步.

sentences.en: He accepted the award with characteristic modesty.
sentences.cn: 他以他一贯的谦逊态度接受了奖励。

sentences.en: He plays the character with tremendous concentration combined with a pleasing modesty.
sentences.cn: 他表演这个角色时倾注了巨大的心血，而且非常谦虚和善。

sentences.en: He won praises for his modesty.
Her modesty is all put on; at heart she is very vain.
sentences.cn: 她的谦逊全是假装的, 内心里她是很虚荣的.

sentences.en: His modesty does him credit, for the food he produces speaks for itself.
sentences.cn: 他的谦逊值得赞扬，因为他做的食物品质之高显而易见。

sentences.en: In many writers modesty is a pose, but in Ford it seems to have been genuine.
sentences.cn: 很多作家都是故作谦虚，但福特却似乎表里如一。

sentences.en: Industry and modesty are the chief factors of his success.
sentences.cn: 勤奋和谦虚是他成功的主要因素.

sentences.en: Modesty forbade me from mentioning that my novel had been published.
sentences.cn: 我不好意思说我的小说已经出版了.

sentences.en: Modesty helps one to go forward.
Modesty is a kind of virtue.
She accepted their congratulations with becoming modesty.
sentences.cn: 她不卑不亢地接受了他们的祝贺.

sentences.en: The girl flushed from modesty when the man praised her appearance.
sentences.cn: 那男人夸奖这姑娘长得漂亮时,她羞得脸红了.

sentences.en: There were shrieks of em-barrassment as the girls struggled to protect their modesty.
sentences.cn: 竭力保持着端庄形象的女孩们发出了尴尬的尖叫。

sentences.en: There were shrieks of embarrassment as the girls struggled to protect their modesty.
sentences.cn: 竭力保持着端庄形象的女孩们发出了尴尬的尖叫。

words.tran_cn: 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

trans.tran_cn: 谦虚，谦逊，稳重，端庄，朴实，质朴
trans.tran_en: the fact of not talking much about your abilities or possessions
